dimensions.name: perceived_engineering_competence
dimensions.description: Subjective feeling of being a competent engineer - the sense of mastery, capability, and professional self-efficacy

dimensions.name: deep_technical_learning
dimensions.description: Sustained engagement with complex technical topics like programming concepts, algorithms, cryptography, or systems design
dimensions.how_to_measure: For each search or visit, code 1 if it relates to complex technical topics: programming languages (Haskell, Scala, OCaml, Rust, Ruby), CS concepts (monads, functors, applicatives, type theory, referential transparency), cryptography (AES, TLS, encryption, PUF), systems architecture, algorithms, data structures. Code 0 otherwise.
dimensions._changed: Removed sequence/window detection from how_to_measure - now simple binary per event. Changed granularity to hourly from finest. Changed dtype from count to binary.

dimensions.name: comparative_learning
dimensions.description: Searches comparing or contrasting concepts, indicating active synthesis and deeper understanding
dimensions.how_to_measure: Code 1 if the search contains comparison language: 'vs', 'versus', 'compared to', 'difference between', 'X or Y', 'better than', 'instead of', 'alternative to'. Code 0 otherwise.
dimensions._changed: Renamed from concept_mastery_progression. Completely changed measurement - now detects comparison language per event rather than requiring cross-event sequence detection. Changed granularity to hourly.

dimensions.name: problem_solving_activity
dimensions.description: Active debugging, troubleshooting, and fixing technical issues - the practical application of engineering skills
dimensions.how_to_measure: Code 1 if the search/visit contains debugging indicators: 'error', 'exception', 'stacktrace', 'not working', 'how to fix', 'issue', 'bug', 'undefined', 'failed', 'troubleshoot', or visits to Stack Overflow question pages, GitHub issues, Sentry. Code 0 otherwise.
dimensions._changed: Changed granularity from finest to hourly. Changed dtype from count to binary. Clarified how_to_measure as binary coding per event.

dimensions.name: technical_depth_engagement
dimensions.description: Engagement with advanced, authoritative technical sources indicating serious study
dimensions.how_to_measure: Code 1 if visit is to: academic sources (arXiv, ResearchGate, scholar.google, .edu domains, PDF papers), official documentation (wiki.haskell.org, hackage, docs.*, archlinux wiki, MDN, RFCs), or technical discussion (HackerNews threads, lobste.rs). Code 0 otherwise.
dimensions._changed: Changed granularity from finest to hourly. Changed dtype from count to binary. Clarified as binary coding per event.

dimensions.name: browsing_topic
dimensions.description: The topical category of each browsing event - used to compute attention fragmentation via entropy
dimensions.how_to_measure: Classify each search/visit into exactly one category: (1) tech-programming: code, languages, frameworks, libraries; (2) tech-systems: Linux, hardware, networking, devops; (3) tech-research: ML, AI, academic CS; (4) reference: Wikipedia, encyclopedic lookups; (5) travel: destinations, flights, hotels; (6) food: restaurants, recipes, dining; (7) music-entertainment: music, video, streaming, games; (8) health: medical, fitness, wellness, substances; (9) shopping: products, purchases, reviews; (10) other: anything not fitting above.
dimensions._changed: Renamed from attention_fragmentation. Complete redesign: now measures topic category per event (categorical) with entropy aggregation, rather than asking workers to compute switch rates. Kept finest granularity as entropy requires per-event categories.

dimensions.name: cognitive_capacity
dimensions.description: Underlying mental energy and capacity for focused intellectual work - not directly observed but inferred

dimensions.name: intellectual_curiosity_exploration
dimensions.description: Exploratory learning driven by curiosity rather than immediate work needs
dimensions.how_to_measure: Code 1 if the search/visit is: Wikipedia article, 'what is X' query, 'how does X work' query, 'history of X', or exploratory content not tied to debugging or immediate work tasks. Code 0 otherwise.
dimensions._changed: Changed granularity from finest to hourly. Changed dtype from count to binary.

dimensions.name: mental_health_seeking
dimensions.description: Searches related to mental health, mood enhancement substances, depression - indicates potential struggles affecting engineering capacity
dimensions.how_to_measure: Code 1 if search/visit relates to: depression, anxiety, mental health treatment, therapy, psychiatric medications, mood-altering substances (ketamine, psychedelics), nootropics (piracetam, modafinil), or coping/self-help for mental struggles. Code 0 otherwise.
dimensions._changed: Changed granularity from finest to hourly. Changed dtype from count to binary.

dimensions.name: late_night_activity
dimensions.description: Browsing activity during late night hours - proxy for sleep disruption or irregular schedule affecting next-day cognition
dimensions.how_to_measure: Code 1 if the event timestamp falls between 00:00-05:00. Code 0 otherwise.

dimensions.name: leisure_browsing
dimensions.description: Non-technical leisure activities - can indicate both healthy recovery and potential avoidance/distraction
dimensions.how_to_measure: Code 1 if search/visit relates to: travel planning (destinations, flights, hotels), restaurants/food, music/entertainment, nightlife, beaches, vacation, streaming content, sports, hobbies. Code 0 otherwise.
dimensions._changed: Changed granularity from finest to hourly. Changed dtype from count to binary.

dimensions.name: health_optimization_interest
dimensions.description: Interest in health tracking, biohacking, and self-optimization - indicates proactive self-management orientation
dimensions.how_to_measure: Code 1 if search/visit relates to: sleep trackers (Oura, Dreem, Whoop), fitness trackers, calorie calculators, diet plans (keto, fasting), biohacking, health monitoring devices, quantified self. Code 0 otherwise.
dimensions._changed: Changed granularity from finest to hourly. Changed dtype from count to binary.

dimensions.name: is_weekend
dimensions.description: Whether the day is Saturday or Sunday - affects available time and type of engagement
dimensions.how_to_measure: Code 1 if the date is Saturday or Sunday. Code 0 for Monday-Friday.

dimensions.name: total_browsing_volume
dimensions.description: Overall daily activity level - baseline engagement with digital world
dimensions.how_to_measure: Code 1 for each search or visit event (every row counts as 1).
dimensions._changed: Fixed how_to_measure to describe per-event coding (1 per event) rather than daily total. Changed granularity from finest to hourly. Changed dtype from count to binary.

dimensions.name: morning_technical_start
dimensions.description: Whether technical work began in the morning - indicates disciplined routine enabling deep work
dimensions.how_to_measure: Code 1 if a technical search/visit (programming, CS, systems topics) occurred between 06:00-12:00. Code 0 otherwise.
dimensions._changed: Renamed from work_start_hour. Complete redesign: changed from continuous hour requiring 'first' detection to binary 'morning technical activity' which is per-event assessable. Changed aggregation from first to max.

dimensions.name: technology_evaluation
dimensions.description: Exploring and comparing tools, languages, frameworks - indicates growth mindset and staying current
dimensions.how_to_measure: Code 1 if search/visit involves: technology comparisons ('X vs Y', 'X alternatives', 'best X for'), tool evaluations ('X review', 'X pros cons'), or researching current/emerging tools (GPT, ChatGPT, LLM, new frameworks, new languages). Code 0 otherwise.
dimensions._changed: Renamed from new_technology_exploration. Removed 'appear to be new' which required historical context. Now focused on observable comparison/evaluation language. Changed granularity from finest to hourly. Changed dtype from count to binary.

dimensions.name: hardware_tooling_interest
dimensions.description: Interest in engineering hardware and tooling setup - indicates investment in craft
dimensions.how_to_measure: Code 1 if search/visit relates to: development laptops (ThinkPad, MacBook Pro for dev), Linux setup/configuration, terminal/shell tools, IDE settings, dotfiles, development environment optimization. Code 0 otherwise.
dimensions._changed: Changed granularity from finest to hourly. Changed dtype from count to binary.

edges.description: Higher cognitive capacity enables sustained engagement with complex technical topics
Lower cognitive capacity leads to higher entropy in browsing topics (more scattered)
Cognitive resources are needed for effective debugging and troubleshooting
Mental health struggles (indicated by substance/therapy seeking) deplete cognitive capacity the following day
Late night browsing disrupts sleep, reducing next-day cognitive capacity
Proactive health management leads to improved cognitive capacity over time
Successfully engaging with complex technical material directly builds sense of competence
Actively comparing and contrasting concepts indicates synthesis and reinforces competence feeling
Successfully debugging and fixing issues demonstrates practical engineering capability
Engaging with serious technical sources signals to self that one is doing real engineering work
Higher topic entropy (fragmentation) undermines sense of competence; focused browsing supports it
Curiosity-driven learning reinforces identity as thoughtful, engaged engineer
Evaluating and comparing technologies maintains sense of relevance and growth
Deep engagement with technical topics leads to comparative queries as understanding deepens
Reading authoritative sources prompts comparison of approaches and concepts
Curiosity provides motivation for sustained technical engagement
Same-day leisure browsing competes for time with deep technical work (negative)
Leisure and recovery activities restore cognitive capacity for the next day
Weekends naturally have more leisure browsing
Weekends may enable more personal technical learning or reduce work-related learning
Higher overall activity creates more opportunity for deep technical engagement
Starting technical work in the morning enables more accumulated deep work
Morning starts correlate with more focused (lower entropy) browsing patterns
Feeling competent motivates continued technical learning - virtuous cycle
Competence feeling frees mental space for curious exploration
Investing in engineering craft and tools reinforces professional identity
Debugging problems drives consultation of authoritative documentation
Mental health struggles manifest as more scattered (higher entropy) browsing same day
Higher topic entropy (fragmentation) inhibits ability to engage deeply (negative)
Evaluating new technologies sparks broader intellectual curiosity
Low cognitive capacity may drive escape into leisure browsing as avoidance
More overall browsing creates more opportunity for leisure content
Mental energy enables exploration of unfamiliar technical territory
Feeling competent gives confidence to explore and evaluate new technologies
